intro: Tibouchina trianae, commonly known as the Tamanu tree, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant is evergreen and typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its flowers are borne in clusters and are known for their fragrant scent, which attracts various pollinators. Tibouchina trianae is also valued for its ornamental qualities and has traditional uses in local medicine.
